result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J Koback was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.   
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with all conditions set forth in 13CF475 Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J Koback

defendant.name: Koback, Cody J
defendant.address: 905 N Old Wausau Rd, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody J Koback in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 13CF475, 14CF27

2:04 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Atty Cousins states correction to the PSI.
Atty Kryshak concurs.  This is some dispute, but no corrections.  Has reviewed the PSI with his client. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

Victim is present and makes a statement to the Court.  

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
13CF475 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program. 
Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.
Engage in any cousneling deemed appropriate by the agent
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: Alexis Kniprath including 3rd party, social media, text
Sign all necessary releases for treatment providers so agent can monitor. 
Agent is to evaluate whether or not there should be a no drink provision as a rule and/or a prohibition on being in bars or taverns. 
Pay costs, victim witness surcharge and filing fee. 
Court finds under 973.015 expungment granted if he successfully completes probation. 

13CF475 Count 4 - 
90 days jail.  3 days credit.
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
First 30 days in jail.  Balance can be on electronic monitoring or GPS. 
Good time can be prorata on the jail and prorata on the electronic monitoring
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 

14CF27  Counts 5 & 6 - 
6 months jail on each count, concurrent to each other - STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1 of 13CF475. 
Pay costs, victim witness surcharge, filing fee and DNA surcharge on each of the counts. 

Any bond monies posted in either file are to be applied to the costs. 
Court advises of 20 days postconviction.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Cody J Koback in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF475 and 14CF27.

1:08 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF475:
Count 1 - No Contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No Contest

14CF27:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - No Contest
Count 6 - No Contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Victim notification had been done by the State.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & Count 4 of 13CF475 and Count 5 & Count 6 of 14CF27 all remaining Counts are DRI.  

BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered.
PSI to be completed by January 16, 2015 and copies forwarded to counsel.
Bond and conditions of bond continued.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Bond Modified: Defendant will be allowed to  possess archery equipment for the purpose of hunting. /s/TTF  10-13-14
Plea hearing on November 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 8, 2014 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State files information.

Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the information and waives reading.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Bond is ordered continued.

Defendant Cody J Koback in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:48 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Kryshak intends to waive but has not filled out a waiver.
Atty Kryshak addresses the Court, makes statement regarding waiving preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cody J Koback in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
13CF475 cancel PTC and follow this case 14CF27.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Ms. Kniprath.  
Turn the key over within 24 hours.
***Bond Modified: Defendant will be allowed to  possess archery equipment for the purpose of hunting. /s/TTF  10-13-14***

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears in Court with Atty Gary Kryshak. 

ADA C. Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping, Stalking.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Kryshak will continue to represent the defendant on this case as well.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  01-21-2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Atty Cousins recommends a $6,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. Before bond is granted, the defendant be required to turn over the extra key to Ms. Kniprath. 
Atty Kryshak makes arguments regarding bond.  Asks for the same bond, no contact and turn over the key.
